meanings.def: to join together with other people in order to do something as a group
examples: Nationalist parties united to oppose the government's plans.
unite in something Local resident groups have united in opposition to the plan.
unite in doing something We will unite in fighting crime.
unite behind/against somebody/something Will they unite behind the new leader?

meanings.def: to make people or things join together to form a unit; to join together
examples: unite (somebody/something) A special bond unites our two countries.
His aim was to unite Italy.
unite (somebody/something) (with somebody/something) She unites keen business skills with a charming personality.
uniting the North with the South

meanings.def: one of the largest British trade unions with members in most industries. It was formed in 2007 when Amicus joined with the TGWU.
